title: Procurement overview
line1: Before you start, make sure to review the procurement guidance available in the 'Documents' section of the G-Cloud 13 Agreements Page. Refer to 'Step 1 - prepare' of the guidance document for advice on establishing your requirements, and consult 'Step 5 - award and buy' to check if you need approval to spend money on a service.

sections: You can name your project in this section.

events.buttonText1: See a list of  your saved searches
sections: Save your search so you can export your results later. The guidance document covers generating a longlist and filtering down to a shortlist in Steps 2 and 3. Ensure you assess all shortlisted services.
Follow 'Step 4 - evaluation and selection' for assessing services, choosing the one that best meets your budget and requirements, and handling clarification questions.
Do not hold a competition to decide the winner. While you can contact suppliers to ask clarification questions, you must not negotiate with them.

Follow the guidance for awarding a contract laid out in 'Step 5 - award and buy', which also advises on whether you need to publish the details on Contracts Finder. Whether or not you award a contract, tell us the outcome. This information helps us improve.
You must submit a Customer Benefits Record. The Crown Commercial Service will contact you if they find any issues with the supplier.
